alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Jackson; Johnson; Lawrence; Monroe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Monroe, west central Decatur, southern Johnson, Bartholomew, Brown, Lawrence and northwestern Jackson Counties through 230 PM EST... At 159 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Columbus, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Monroe, west central Decatur, southern Johnson, Bartholomew, Brown, Lawrence and northwestern Jackson Counties, including the following locations... Peoga, Newbern, Hartsville, Tunnelton, Gnaw Bone, Bartlettsville, Vallonia, Spurgeons Corner, Medora and Azalia. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 55 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for central Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Jackson; Johnson; Lawrence; Monroe
